Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer violated IRPA s.113(b) by making an adverse credibility finding without holding a hearing
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed torture and detention in Sri Lanka, supported by medical evidence; officer found inconsistencies in narrative
Decision_Outcome: PRRA application denied; judicial review dismissed
Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking protection under PRRA process
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer made adverse credibility finding without holding a hearing
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged violation of procedural fairness under IRPA s.113(b)
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applies to judicial review of PRRA decisions
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant's claims, probative value of supporting evidence
Procedural_Issue: Requirement of a hearing before making determinative adverse credibility findings
Credibility_Assessment: Officer found inconsistencies in applicant’s story; deemed additional evidence lacking probative value
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s.113(b) – procedural fairness in credibility assessments
Application_Basis: Risk of torture or detention upon removal to Sri Lanka
Relief_Sought: Overturn of PRRA denial, recognition of risk on return
Governing_Rule: Adverse credibility findings requiring a hearing if determinative
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of probative value attributed to additional evidence by officer
Decisional_Body: Immigration Officer, Federal Court (on judicial review)
Harm_Assessment: Risk of torture and detention in Sri Lanka alleged
Cause_Description: Applicant sought judicial review after PRRA denial, alleging procedural unfairness
Evidence_Handling: Officer assessed credibility without hearing, based on written record
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s.113(b) – alleged breach of procedural fairness
Evidence_Issues: Contradictory evidence cited by officer; lack of new probative evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Detailed reasoning provided by officer despite no hearing
Decision_Rationale: Decision found reasonable due to contradictory evidence and thorough analysis
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in applicant’s account; insufficient weight given to medical evidence
